Question
========

From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 18, mean = 45, sd = 9.28 Sample 2: n = 19, mean = 46, sd = 10.01. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 93.36. It is tested Whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

Answerlist
----------

* A T distribution with 37 degrees of freedom
* A T distribution with 35 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 18 and 19 degrees of freedom
* An F-division with 17 and 18 degrees of freedom

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* A T-distribution with 37 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* A T-division with 35 degrees of freedom: Correct
* An F-division with 18 and 19 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
* An F-division with 17 and 18 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
